alert.note: Alert for Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 31 at 9:48AM EST until December 31 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: .The potential for ice jams on Buffalo area creeks will decrease today as relatively thin, slushy ice is flushed downstream. Rain today and tonight will contribute to increased runoff in addition to ongoing snowmelt and bring another increase in flows late today through Sunday on the Buffalo area creeks. Minor poor drainage flooding is also possible in urban areas where piles of snow are blocking drainage structures this weekend. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is possible from ice jams along the Buffalo area creeks through today, but ice jam potential is decreasing as ice is flushed downstream. Minor flooding is also possible later today through Sunday morning on the Buffalo area creeks due to increased runoff from snowmelt and rainfall. Minor flooding is possible in urban areas this weekend where piles of snow are blocking drainage structures. * WHERE...Erie County. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
